title: As a User I want the Trade Summary report to display three way trades
custom_steps: From EBISII-17147 - The Trade Summary report is currently only able to handle trades between two clubs and needs to be updated to handle three (or even four) way trades.  See the referenced Jira for some examples.AC:* All information from a three way trade displays correctly on the trade summary report* All information from a simple two way trade displays correctly on the trade summary reportNote: we may need to redesign the report layout on this in order to accommodate this request

title: MNC Prints without Dollars on $0 Living Allowance
custom_steps: At least on the first-year international side, when a club includes CEP language in the player's terms, if they select the entirety of the CEP money be allocated to tuition (so $0.00 in living allowance), the contract will print that as "$200,000 in tuition and $.00 in living allowance."It would be great if that could say "$0.00" - it prints perfectly if living allowance is greater than 0.Hans Montero (NYY) is an example: !image-2021-02-02-11-21-28-998.png|thumbnail!  !image-2021-02-02-11-22-51-766.png|thumbnail!

title: As an MNC Admin, I do not want the Release Clause table to print when Clubs include Custom Language
custom_steps: AC: - Currently when a Club chooses Custom Language for Release Clause on an MNC, the table prints with the contract - When Custom Language is chosen, the table should not print with the contract.  Only what is included in the Custom Language section should print. - The table should continue printing when standard language is chosen

title: As a User, I want to Print the SFD from the Transfer to 60-Day IL (Minor) transaction
custom_steps:
The MN Transfer to 60 Day IL Transaction will now work the same as the MJ Transfer to 60 Day IL Transaction

MJ Data Discovery: https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3786605/Transfer+Player+to+10+or+60-Day+DL  

MJ 60-Day IL SFD: https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3786420/MJ+SFD+-+Transfer+to+60+Day+DL+Layout 

Clipboard Notifications:  https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3786724/DL+-+Clipboard

AC:

There will be a new SFD created for the MN Transfer to 60 Day IL transaction

There will be a “ Received SFD” checkbox added to the transaction

The box will be disabled for Club users if an attachment with a label of "Standard Form of Diagnosis" is not attached.

A notification will be generated when a SFD is attached after the TX has been submitted (Message #6)

If 3 days have passed since the TX was submitted w/o a SFD being submitted, a notification will be generated  (Message #7)

This story should cover the esign process

title: As a developer I want to convert the salary arbitration reports to crystal enterprise
custom_steps:
The following salary arbitration reports need to be converted to crystal enterprise.  The front end should make an initial call to the ebis backend which writes the results into snapshot tables for arbitration.  The report will then be recreated in crystal enterprise using those snapshot tables.  All three reports should be able to run off of the same
snapshot tables.

2+ Salary Arbitration "Super Two" eligibility
2+ and 3+ Salary Arbitration Eligibility
Salary Arbitration

AC:
* Reports are identical to their prior versions (with the caveat that any errors in the existing reports should be corrected rather than just carried forward)

title: Update MJC Signing Bonus Boilerplate
custom_steps:
Please adjust the auto-generated MJC signing bonus language as indicated below in red:

In addition to the salary set forth in this contract, the Player shall receive a signing bonus as follows. This signing bonus shall be deemed earned only upon Club's receipt of the approval of this Contract by the Office of the Commissioner of Baseball. This signing bonus shall be paid to player on date below, or if no date is specified, within ten (10) business days of the Club's receipt of approval of this Contract by the Office of the Commissioner of Baseball; provided, however, that if the {color:#ff0000}payment{color} date {color:#ff0000}--of payment of the signing bonus will be payable on the first business day following such --{color}falls on a Saturday, Sunday or legal holiday{color:#ff0000}, then the signing bonus shall be payable on the next business day.{color}

title: As a Risk Management User, I want to access my Biannual Queries as Self Service Reports
INC0170878:  IL Summary Inconsistent on Combined Placements
custom_steps: Description: When choosing to combine placements on a IL Summary report, the report is inconsistent in how it populates the following fields: - Placed To - Placed On - Earliest Reinstatement - Transferred to the 60-day IL - Reinstated OnAC: - When running the IL Summary Report, if the user specifies "Combine Placements: Yes" the report should only use data from the most recent IL Placement when populating the following fields: - Placed To - Placed On - Earliest Reinstatement - Transferred to the 60-day IL - Reinstated On

title: INC0139537 - Total Payroll Reports not working
custom_preconds:
Received from: Matt.Kleine@brewers.com 
Recipients: ebissupport@mlb.com 

Hello â€“ 

The â€œTotal Payrollâ€� reports have not been functioning for at least the past 24 hours or so. We have a fairly time-sensitive project we are completing presently that requires this information. Additionally, when I attempted a workaround using the Multi-Year report, it appeared to provide incomplete information (e.g. it shows us having just a $25m payroll in 2015). 

Is this a known issue already, and is it possible to get that resolved today?

title: As a BOC Admin User, I want updates to the PIS Report
custom_steps:
AC:

* The Waivers Request Date column will be removed from the Player Information Summary Report
* The Outright Waivers in Effect column will be renamed to "Waivers in Effect"
* Values in the Waivers in Effect column will include the following:
** Y
** N
** Pending
*** Pending will only appear in the Waivers in Effect column if the player appears on  an unexpired waiver bulletin
* Potential MNFA column will include an * if the player would be a free agent, only if outrighted during the minor league season that year and accrues his final year toward free agency.
** (as opposed to a player who already used 1 of 1 or 7 of 7 â€“ that player should get the Y without the *.)
** This is the same asterisk that appears on the Contract History widget ([https://ebis.mlb.com/ebisui/#/pro-player-profile/contracts?playerId=369646|https://ebis.mlb.com/ebisui/#/pro-player-profile/contracts?playerId=369646])
** Will add a footnote explaining what the asterisk means â€œ* - Player will only become a FA if assigned during current seasonâ€�

custom_steps:
AC:

* The Player Information Summary Report will display comments added into the Roster Comments box at the bottom of the report
* This comment field will need to be permission based as only BOC Transaction Super Admin Users are allowed to see these comments

title: As a User, I would like recently Outrighted Players to appear on the Player Information Summary Report
custom_steps:
INC0141297

AC:

* Player whoâ€™s Outright Date is *<= 15* Day earlier than todayâ€™s date, the player will appear on the Player Information Summary Report
* The report should not run any slower
* This will apply to both position players and pitchers



----

From: Sam Menzin <Sam.Menzin@tigers.com [Sam.Menzin@tigers.com|mailto:Sam.Menzin@tigers.com]> 
Sent: Wednesday, August 7, 2019 3:37 PM
To: Pfeifer, Jeff <jeff.pfeifer@mlb.com [jeff.pfeifer@mlb.com|mailto:jeff.pfeifer@mlb.com]>
Cc: Horan, Garrett <Garrett.Horan@mlb.com [Garrett.Horan@mlb.com|mailto:Garrett.Horan@mlb.com]>
Subject: Player Info Summary 

Hey Jeff,

Just going through some old notes, would it be possible to add outrighted players to the Player Info Summary report if they are still within the 10-day period? I know we discussed this last year and while itâ€™s a 40-man report it would seem possible that any player under the 10-day restriction could also be identified and displayed. 

Thanks,

Sam

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Sam Menzin

Detroit Tigers | Director, Baseball Operations & Pro Scouting

O: 313-471-2431

C: 516-639-9077

title: INC0163996 - Change wording on trade checklist for drafted players
custom_steps:
We need to change the trade checklist wording for the following scenario:

Current Logic:
IF: 
A player's Rule 4 Status is Drafted AND
The Transaction Date is before one full year from his First Year Contract Signing Date.
Display:
"The following player(s) are recent draft selections and may not be traded until one year has passed from the date the player signed his first contract."

New logic:
IF: 
A player's Rule 4 Status is Drafted AND
The Transaction Date is before 9:00 A.M ET on the day following the day that the last game of the World Series had started or 90 days from the date the player signed, whichever is later

Display:
"...recent draft selections and may not be traded until 9:00 A.M ET on the day following the day that the last game of the World Series had started or 90 days from the date the player signed, whichever is later.Â  Please confirm with MLB that this player may be assigned at this time."


Original SNOW from Jeff:
"We need to change language on TRD checklist for a drafted player who is traded in year of trade.Â  It is no longer one year.Â  How about "...recent draft selections and may not be traded until 9:00 A.M ET on the day following the day that the last game of the World Series had started or 90 days from the date the player signed, whichever is later.Â  Please confirm with MLB that this player may be assigned at this time."

Thanks"

title: Updates to CA Signings 2<x<7
custom_steps:
Related to: EBISII-18298

â€¢	Day calculations:
o	The ML piece is based on ML service time. As you know per the CBA, 172 ML service days constitutes 1 ML service year. The service time season clock starts on the first day of the regular season. The season clock weâ€™re looking for, however, starts on the first day of Spring Training. Is there any way you could calculate a column called â€œduty daysâ€� for us based on this instead of service time?
o	The MN piece is called â€œDays with Clubâ€� on the last tab. This could be the piece we use to calculate duty days, but I would like to know where the clock starts. Is it the day you were assigned there? Date of Spring Training start? Date of the first game? Ideally we should try to get this in line with what I mentioned above.
o	Once we settle on a good duty day calculation, we will have to calculate playersâ€™ % of duty days in CA in their last year with the CA affiliate or Club. We could take the days and divide them by 365 to get a %. To identify these players, can you add a current status for each player (such as voluntarily retired, inactive, etc.) and then calculate this for their last season? If this is too much to do in the report we generate, I can probably calculate it it myself, but at minimum Iâ€™ll need the current status for each player
â€¢	Season calculations:
o	First tab columns C and D (Major League CA years/days, which tie back to the second tab), are going to need tweaking. Pull up Rich Aurilia on the second tab and youâ€™ll see what I mean.
ï‚§	If we can get the â€œduty dayâ€� calculation instead of service time, can we add however many days span start of spring training to end of regular season = 1 season?
ï‚§	If not, and it has to be based on service time: As stated, 172 ML service days constitutes 1 ML service year. For Aurilia, youâ€™ll see he has 10 years with 172, and 3 incomplete years (one with 171, one with 28, and one with 65). Since he played parts of 13 seasons in CA, weâ€™ll want the first tab to show that. However it is saying 11 years and 92 days. Looks like you get this by taking the days from his 3 incomplete years (264, which is the same as 172+92). So youâ€™re tacking on one year to his existing 10 to get 11 years, and have 92 days left over.
â€¢	Sorry for not mentioning before, but not only do we want CA related days and seasons, we would like you to include columns for a playerâ€™s total days and seasons, so we can subtract and calculate non-CA related days and seasons (if you could do this directly in the report too that would be great).
â€¢	Third tab:
o	Can we add â€œClub Stateâ€� column next to A so we can have some way of bifurcating between CA affiliates and non-CA affiliates for CA Clubs
o	Can we convert â€œOrg IDâ€� to MLB Club

title: As a Developer, I want to update the payroll details report to write results to a table and return a report id
custom_steps: The Payroll Details report currently returns a JSON object which the crystal report pulls using CDATA.  We want to replace that with a REST call to generate report results and store them into a table.  The table structure for this should match the current payroll snapshot tables as they store everything that is needed.The REST call should return an ID which the report can use to pull all of the data.

title: INC0146970 - Updated CBT/LRD Cash Accounting For Payroll Reports
custom_steps: Hey Guys-I wanted to flag an item for discussion after we return from arbitration. As more Clubs‰Ûª payrolls have been proximate to the CBT threshold, we would like to revisit the way we account for cash on the Payrolls reports when it is run ‰ÛÏas of‰Û� a certain date. Right now, my understanding is that EBIS has some fairly convoluted back-end logic to calculate the CBT allocations on multi-year cash transactions, and there‰Ûªs not really any way we can update the resulting calculations.What I would like to do, if possible, is apply that same logic to an additional feature on each Outright (Trade) page. What I‰Ûªm envisioning, on the Mookie Betts trade as an example, would be an additional collapsible section titled ‰ÛÏCash Payroll Allocations‰Û� for trades that include cash considerations. This section would have the same back-end logic that EBIS has now, except only BOC users could adjust the yearly allocations. When running payrolls ‰ÛÏas of‰Û� a certain date, the cash would pull from the allocations assigned to each trade page rather than the back-end logic. Basically, it would give us the ability to make manual adjustments to cash, which many Clubs have requested.Let me know if there‰Ûªs a good time in early March to discuss this new feature, and I can put together a more robust description of the desired functionality in the interim.Thanks,Cameron

title: As a User, I want player letter to print in both english and spanish for spanish speaking players
custom_steps: INC0141822AC:* If a player has their language set to Spanish on their profile, player letters printed directly from the player will print in both English and Spanish* This applies to the following letters:‰Û¢	Consent of Transfer of Rehabilitation Form‰Û¢	Consent to Continue Rehab at ST Facility Beyond 20 Days‰Û¢	Letter To Potential MNFA‰Û¢	Minor League Life Insurance Form‰Û¢	Notice of Unconditional Release Waivers‰Û¢	Notice Player Five Plus Year MLS Optional Assignment‰Û¢	Notice Player Five Plus Year MLS Outright‰Û¢	Notice to Player of Intention of Unconditional Release‰Û¢	Notice to Player of UR and Termination of Major League Contract‰Û¢	Notice to Player with 3 or more years MLS or second Outright‰Û¢	Notice to Player with Super 2 Status‰Û¢	SCAT5 Form
